requirements.title: Policies for Information Security
requirements.summary: A set of policies for information security shall be defined, approved by management, published and communicated to employees and relevant external parties.

requirements.title: Review of the Policies for Information Security
requirements.summary: The policies for information security shall be reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.

requirements.title: Information Security Roles and Responsibilities
requirements.summary: All information security responsibilities shall be defined and allocated.

requirements.title: Segregation of Duties
requirements.summary: Conflicting duties and areas of responsibility shall be segregated to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of the organization’s assets.

requirements.title: Contact with Authorities
requirements.summary: Appropriate contacts with relevant authorities shall be maintained.

requirements.title: Contact with Special Interest Groups
requirements.summary: Appropriate contacts with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations shall be maintained.

requirements.title: Confidentiality agreements
requirements.summary: Requirements for confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization’s needs for the protection of information should be identified and regularly reviewed.

requirements.title: Information Security in Project Management
requirements.summary: Information security shall be addressed in project management, regardless of the type of the project.

requirements.title: Mobile Device Policy
requirements.summary: A policy and supporting security measures shall be adopted to manage the risks introduced by using mobile devices.

requirements.title: Teleworking
requirements.summary: A policy and supporting security measures shall be implemented to protect information accessed, processed or stored at teleworking sites.

requirements.title: Screening
requirements.summary: Background verification checks on all candidates for employment shall be carried out in accordance with relevant laws, regulations and ethics and shall be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.

requirements.title: Terms and Conditions of Employment
requirements.summary: The contractual agreements with employees and contractors shall state their and the organization’s responsibilities for information security.

requirements.title: Management Responsibilities
requirements.summary: Management shall require all employees and contractors to apply information security in accordance with the established policies and procedures of the organization.

requirements.title: Information Security Awareness, Education and Training
requirements.summary: All employees of the organization and, where relevant, contractors shall receive appropriate awareness education and training and regular updates in organizational policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.

requirements.title: Disciplinary Process
requirements.summary: There shall be a formal and communicated disciplinary process in place to take action against employees who have committed an information security breach.

requirements.title: Termination or Change of Employment Responsibilities
requirements.summary: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, communicated to the employee or contractor and enforced.

requirements.title: Inventory of Assets
requirements.summary: Assets associated with information and information processing facilities shall be identified and an inventory of these assets shall be drawn up and maintained.

requirements.title: Ownership of Assets
requirements.summary: Assets maintained in the inventory shall be owned.

requirements.title: Acceptable Use of Assets
requirements.summary: Rules for the acceptable use of information and of assets associated with information and information processing facilities shall be identified, documented and implemented.

requirements.title: Return of Assets
requirements.summary: All employees and external party users shall return all of the organizational assets in their possession upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement.

requirements.title: Classification of Information
requirements.summary: Information shall be classified in terms of legal requirements, value, criticality and sensitivity to unauthorised disclosure or modification.

requirements.title: Labelling of Information
requirements.summary: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.

requirements.title: Handling of Assets
requirements.summary: Procedures for handling assets shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.

requirements.title: Management of Removable Media
requirements.summary: Procedures shall be implemented for the management of removable media in accordance with the classification scheme adopted by the organization.

requirements.title: Disposal of Media
requirements.summary: Media shall be disposed of securely when no longer required, using formal procedures.

requirements.title: Physical Media Transfer
requirements.summary: Media containing information shall be protected against unauthorized access, misuse or corruption during transportation.

requirements.title: Access Control Policy
requirements.summary: An access control policy shall be established, documented and reviewed based on business and information security requirements.

requirements.title: Access to Networks and Network Services
requirements.summary: Users shall only be provided with access to the network and network services that they have been specifically authorized to use.

requirements.title: User Registration and De-registration
requirements.summary: A formal user registration and de-registration process shall be implemented to enable assignment of access rights.

requirements.title: User Access Provisioning
requirements.summary: A formal user access provisioning process shall be implemented to assign or revoke access rights for all user types to all systems and services.

requirements.title: Management of Priviledged Access Rights
requirements.summary: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and controlled.

requirements.title: Management of Secrete Authentication Information of Users
requirements.summary: The allocation of secret authentication information shall be controlled through a formal management process.

requirements.title: Review of User Access Rights
requirements.summary: Asset owners shall review users’ access rights at regular intervals.

requirements.title: Removal or Adjustment of Access Rights
requirements.summary: The access rights of all employees and external party users to information and information processing facilities shall be removed upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement, or adjusted upon change.

requirements.title: Use of Secrete Authentication Information
requirements.summary: Users shall be required to follow the organization’s practices in the use of secret authentication information.

requirements.title: Information Access Restriction
requirements.summary: Access to information and application system functions shall be restricted in accordance with the access control policy.

requirements.title: Secure Log-on Procedures
requirements.summary: Where required by the access control policy, access to systems and applications shall be controlled by a secure log-on procedure.

requirements.title: Password Management System
requirements.summary: Password management systems shall be interactive and shall ensure quality passwords.

requirements.title: Use of Privileged Utility Programs
requirements.summary: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.

requirements.title: Access Control to Program Source Code
requirements.summary: Access to program source code shall be restricted.

requirements.title: Policy on the Use of Cryptographic Controls
requirements.summary: A policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information shall be developed and implemented.

requirements.title: Key Management
requirements.summary: A policy on the use, protection and lifetime of cryptographic keys shall be developed and implemented through their whole lifecycle.

requirements.title: Physical Security Perimeter
requirements.summary: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain either sensitive or critical information and information processing facilities.

requirements.title: Physical Entry Controls
requirements.summary: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.

requirements.title: Securing Offices, Rooms and Facilities
requirements.summary: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and applied.

requirements.title: Protecting Against External and Environmental Threats
requirements.summary: Physical protection against natural disasters, malicious attack or accidents shall be designed and applied.

requirements.title: Working In Secure Areas
requirements.summary: Procedures for working in secure areas shall be designed and applied.

requirements.title: Delivery and Loading Areas
requirements.summary: Access points such as delivery and loading areas and other points where unauthorized persons could enter the premises shall be controlled and, if possible, isolated from information processing facilities to avoid unauthorized access.

requirements.title: Equipment Siting and Protection
requirements.summary: Equipment shall be sited and protected to reduce the risks from environmental threats and hazards, and opportunities for unauthorized access.

requirements.title: Supporting Utilities
requirements.summary: Equipment shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.

requirements.title: Cabling Security
requirements.summary: Power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services shall be protected from interception, interference or damage.

requirements.title: Equipment Maintenance
requirements.summary: Equipment shall be correctly maintained to ensure its continued availability and integrity.

requirements.title: Removal of Assets
requirements.summary: Equipment, information or software shall not be taken off-site without prior authorization.

requirements.title: Security of Equipment and Assets Off-Premises
requirements.summary: Security shall be applied to off-site assets taking into account the different risks of working outside the organization’s premises.

requirements.title: Secure Disposal or Reuse of Equipment
requirements.summary: All items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.

requirements.title: Unattended User Equipment
requirements.summary: Users shall ensure that unattended equipment has appropriate protection.

requirements.title: Clear Desk and Clear Screen Policy
requirements.summary: A clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media and a clear screen policy for information processing facilities shall be adopted.

requirements.title: Documented Operating Procedures
requirements.summary: Operating procedures shall be documented and made available to all users who need them.

requirements.title: Change Management
requirements.summary: Changes to the organization, business processes, information processing facilities and systems that affect information security shall be controlled.

requirements.title: Capacity Management
requirements.summary: The use of resources shall be monitored, tuned and projections made of future capacity requirements to ensure the required system performance.

requirements.title: Separation of Development, Testing and Operational Environments
requirements.summary: Development, testing, and operational environments shall be separated to reduce the risks of unauthorized access or changes to the operational environment.

requirements.title: Controls Against Malware
requirements.summary: Detection, prevention and recovery controls to protect against malware shall be implemented, combined with appropriate user awareness.

requirements.title: Information Backup
requirements.summary: Backup copies of information, software and system images shall be taken and tested regularly in accordance with an agreed backup policy.

requirements.title: Event Logging
requirements.summary: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, faults and information security events shall be produced, kept and regularly reviewed.

requirements.title: Protection of Log Information
requirements.summary: Logging facilities and log information shall be protected against tampering and unauthorized access.

requirements.title: Administrator and Operator Logs
requirements.summary: System administrator and system operator activities shall be logged and the logs protected and regularly reviewed.

requirements.title: Clock Synchronization
requirements.summary: The clocks of all relevant information processing systems within an organization or security domain shall be synchronised to a single reference time source.

requirements.title: Installation of Software on Operational Systems
requirements.summary: Procedures shall be implemented to control the installation of software on operational systems.

requirements.title: Management of Technical Vulnerabilities
requirements.summary: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems being used shall be obtained in a timely fashion, the organization’s exposure to such vulnerabilities evaluated and appropriate measures taken to address the associated risk.

requirements.title: Restrictions on Software Installation
requirements.summary: Rules governing the installation of software by users shall be established and implemented.

requirements.title: Information Systems Audit Controls
requirements.summary: Audit requirements and activities involving verification of operational systems shall be carefully planned and agreed to minimise disruptions to business processes.

requirements.title: Network Controls
requirements.summary: Networks shall be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

requirements.title: Security of Network Services
requirements.summary: Security mechanisms, service levels and management requirements of all network services shall be identified and included in network services agreements, whether these services are provided in-house or outsourced.

requirements.title: Segregation in Networks
requirements.summary: Groups of information services, users and information systems shall be segregated on networks.

requirements.title: Information Transfer Policies and Procedures
requirements.summary: Formal transfer policies, procedures and controls shall be in place to protect the transfer of information through the use of all types of communication facilities.

requirements.title: Agreements on Information Transfer
requirements.summary: Agreements shall address the secure transfer of business information between the organization and external parties.

requirements.title: Electronic Messaging
requirements.summary: Information involved in electronic messaging shall be appropriately protected.

requirements.title: Confidentiality or Non-disclosure Agreements
requirements.summary: Requirements for confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization’s needs for the protection of information shall be identified, regularly reviewed and documented.

requirements.title: Information Security Requirements Analysis and Specification
requirements.summary: The information security related requirements shall be included in the requirements for new information systems or enhancements to existing information systems.

requirements.title: Securing Application Services on Public Networks
requirements.summary: Information involved in application services passing over public networks shall be protected from fraudulent activity, contract dispute and unauthorized disclosure and modification.

requirements.title: Protecting Application Services Transactions
requirements.summary: Information involved in application service transactions shall be protected to prevent incomplete transmission, mis-routing, unauthorized message alteration, unauthorized disclosure, unauthorized message duplication or replay.

requirements.title: Secure Development Policy
requirements.summary: Rules for the development of software and systems shall be established and applied to developments within the organization.

requirements.title: System Change Control Procedures
requirements.summary: Changes to systems within the development lifecycle shall be controlled by the use of formal change control procedures.

requirements.title: Technical Review of Applications After Operating Platform Changes
requirements.summary: When operating platforms are changed, business critical applications shall be reviewed and tested to ensure there is no adverse impact on organizational operations or security.

requirements.title: Restrictions on Changes to Software Packages
requirements.summary: Modifications to software packages shall be discouraged, limited to necessary changes and all changes shall be strictly controlled.

requirements.title: Secure System Engineering Principles
requirements.summary: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system implementation efforts.

requirements.title: Secure Development Environment
requirements.summary: Organizations shall establish and appropriately protect secure development environments for system development and integration efforts that cover the entire system development lifecycle.

requirements.title: Outsourced Development
requirements.summary: The organization shall supervise and monitor the activity of outsourced system development.

requirements.title: System Security Testing
requirements.summary: Testing of security functionality shall be carried out during development.

requirements.title: System Acceptance Testing
requirements.summary: Acceptance testing programs and related criteria shall be established for new information systems, upgrades and new versions.

requirements.title: Protection of Test Data
requirements.summary: Test data shall be selected carefully, protected and controlled.

requirements.title: Information Security Policy for Supplier Relationships
requirements.summary: Information security requirements for mitigating the risks associated with supplier’s access to the organization’s assets shall be agreed with the supplier and documented.

requirements.title: Addressing Security within Supplier Agreements
requirements.summary: All relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier that may access, process, store, communicate, or provide IT infrastructure components for, the organization’s information.

requirements.title: Information and Communication Technology Supply Chain
requirements.summary: Agreements with suppliers shall include requirements to address the information security risks associated with information and communications technology services and product supply chain.

requirements.title: Monitoring and Review of Supplier Services
requirements.summary: Organizations shall regularly monitor, review and audit supplier service delivery.

requirements.title: Managing Changes to Supplier Services
requirements.summary: Changes to the provision of services by suppliers, including maintaining and improving existing information security policies, procedures and controls, shall be managed, taking account of the criticality of business information, systems and processes involved and re-assessment of risks.

requirements.title: Regulation of cryptographic controls
requirements.summary: Cryptographic controls should be used in compliance with all relevant agreements, laws, and regulations.

requirements.title: Compliance with security policies and standards
requirements.summary: Managers should ensure that all security procedures within their area of responsibility are carried out correctly to achieve compliance with security policies and standards.

requirements.title: Technical compliance checking
requirements.summary: Information systems should be regularly checked for compliance with security implementation standards.

requirements.title: Information systems audit controls
requirements.summary: Audit requirements and activities involving checks on operational systems should be carefully planned and agreed to minimize the risk of disruptions to business processes.

requirements.title: Protection of information systems audit tools
requirements.summary: Access to information systems audit tools should be protected to prevent any possible misuse or compromise.

requirements.title: Information leakage
requirements.summary: Opportunities for information leakage should be prevented.

requirements.title: Responsibilities and Procedures
requirements.summary: Management responsibilities and procedures shall be established to ensure a quick, effective and orderly response to information security incidents.

requirements.title: Reporting Information Security Events
requirements.summary: Information security events shall be reported through appropriate management channels as quickly as possible.

requirements.title: Reporting Information Security Weaknesses
requirements.summary: Employees and contractors using the organization’s information systems and services shall be required to note and report any observed or suspected information security weaknesses in systems or services.

requirements.title: Assessment of and decision on information security events
requirements.summary: Information security events shall be assessed and it shall be decided if they are to be classified as information security incidents.

requirements.title: Response to Information Security Incidents
requirements.summary: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.

requirements.title: Learning from Information Security Incidents
requirements.summary: Knowledge gained from analysing and resolving information security incidents shall be used to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents.

requirements.title: Collection of Evidence
requirements.summary: The organization shall define and apply procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of information, which can serve as evidence.

sections.title: 17 - Information Security Aspects of Business Continuity Management

requirements.title: Planning Information Security Continuity
requirements.summary: The organization shall determine its requirements for information security and the continuity of information security management in adverse situations, e.g. during a crisis or disaster.

requirements.title: Implementing Information Security Continuity
requirements.summary: The organization shall establish, document, implement and maintain processes, procedures and controls to ensure the required level of continuity for information security during an adverse situation.

requirements.title: Verify, Review and Evaluate Information Security Continuity
requirements.summary: The organization shall verify the established and implemented information security continuity controls at regular intervals in order to ensure that they are valid and effective during adverse situations.

requirements.title: Availability of Information Processing Facilities
requirements.summary: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.

requirements.title: Identification of Applicable Legislation and Contractual Requirements
requirements.summary: All relevant legislative statutory, regulatory, contractual requirements and the organization’s approach to meet these requirements shall be explicitly identified, documented and kept up to date for each information system and the organization.

requirements.title: Intellectual Property Rights
requirements.summary: Appropriate procedures shall be implemented to ensure compliance with legislative, regulatory and contractual requirements related to intellectual property rights and use of proprietary software products.

requirements.title: Protection of Records
requirements.summary: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release, in accordance with legislatory, regulatory, contractual and business requirements.

requirements.title: Privacy and Protection of Personally Identifiable Information
requirements.summary: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information shall be ensured as required in relevant legislation and regulation where applicable.

requirements.title: Regulation of Cryptographic Controls
requirements.summary: Cryptographic controls shall be used in compliance with all relevant agreements, legislation and regulations.

requirements.title: Independent Review of Information Security
requirements.summary: The organization’s approach to managing information security and its implementation (i.e. control objectives, controls, policies, processes and procedures for information security) shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals or when significant changes occur.

requirements.title: Compliance with Security Policies and Standards
requirements.summary: Managers shall regularly review the compliance of information processing and procedures within their area of responsibility with the appropriate security policies, standards and any other security requirements.

requirements.title: Technical Compliance Review
requirements.summary: Information systems shall be regularly reviewed for compliance with the organization’s information security policies and standards.
